column3: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
I have no fear of making changes, destroying the image, etc., because the painting has a life of its own.
The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
Artists who seek perfection in everything are those who cannot attain it in anything.
Riding a race bike is an art - a thing that you do because you feel something inside.
Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.

Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.
Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.
Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.

Excellence is an art won by training and habituation. We do not act rightly because we have virtue or excellence, but we rather have those because we have acted rightly. We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
Architecture is a visual art, and the buildings speak for themselves.
The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.
Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
The modern work of art, as I have said, is a symbol.
The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
Whenever we witness art in a building, we are aware of an energy contained by it.

To me, photography is an art of observation. It's about finding something interesting in an ordinary place... I've found it has little to do with the things you see and everything to do with the way you see them.
